Key Arguments: The author experienced severe adverse reactions to the COVID-19 vaccine, which were labeled as disinformation, preventing her from accessing necessary medical care and support.
Censorship of information regarding vaccine injuries has caused harm to individuals seeking medical help and support.
The proposed legislation would increase censorship, further harming those with vaccine injuries by limiting access to information and support.
There is a lack of government-funded research and support for vaccine injuries due to fear of being labeled as misinformation.
Censorship has led to misinformation about vaccine safety, influencing individuals' decisions to get vaccinated without understanding the risks.
Main Themes: Censorship and its negative impact on public health
Vaccine injury and lack of support
Notable Quotes: The increase of, and normalisation of these powers, and the provision of additional reserve powers, will not protect me and other vaccine-injured Australians from harm, as the bill is intended.
Censorship of all messaging other than official government claims of vaccine safety is directly responsible for my decision to get vaccinated, which has caused me significant harm.
It is my recommendation that all efforts (including this bill) that serve to censor or hide unpopular views, regardless of perceived basis in fact or consensus positions, be abandoned.
